summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Martin G. Weinberg and Assistant U.S. Attorney Reid Weingarten regarding a preservation request for communications related to the Epstein case. The prosecution requests a formalized written request specifying jurisdictions, parties, and types of communications to be preserved.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, requesting preservation of communications between SDNY, Main Justice, and other parties related to Epstein.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Prosecutor with the Southern District of New York responding to defense preservation request and asking for formalized written details.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding about preservation of communications in the Epstein case.

events.title: Preservation Request Correspondence
events.description: Email exchange regarding defense request to preserve communications between SDNY, Main Justice, plaintiffs' lawyers, and clients related to Epstein.

keyFacts: Defense attorney Martin G. Weinberg requested preservation of all communications between SDNY, Main Justice, and plaintiffs' lawyers/clients related to Epstein.
Prosecutor Reid Weingarten requested a formalized written request specifying jurisdictions, parties, and types of communications to be preserved.
The prosecution noted the DOJ has a robust retention policy for electronic communications but couldn't bind other districts or parties.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal maneuvering regarding evidence preservation in the Epstein case in July 2019.
